name: Sternocleidomastoid
insertion: Superior nuchal line of occipital bone

innervation.nerve: Accessory nerve (CN XI)

clinical_relevance: Often involved in whiplash injuries, torticollis, and tension headaches
palpation: Prominent when turning head to opposite side

name: Trapezius (Upper fibers)

innervation.nerve: Accessory nerve (CN XI)

clinical_relevance: Commonly associated with tension headaches and neck pain
palpation: Easily palpable between neck and shoulder
notes: Often overactive in upper crossed syndrome

name: Scalene Anterior

innervation.nerve: Direct branches from cervical plexus

palpation: Deep to SCM, palpable with deep pressure
notes: Can compress brachial plexus and subclavian artery

name: Scalene Medius

innervation.nerve: Direct branches from cervical plexus

clinical_relevance: Largest of scalene muscles, often involved in TOS
notes: Forms posterior boundary of scalene triangle

name: Scalene Posterior

innervation.nerve: Direct branches from cervical plexus

clinical_relevance: Smallest scalene, can contribute to TOS
common_trigger_points: Not commonly treated due to depth
notes: May be absent in some individuals

name: Levator Scapulae

innervation.nerve: Dorsal scapular nerve

clinical_relevance: Common source of neck and shoulder pain
palpation: From superior angle of scapula to cervical spine
notes: Often tight in upper crossed syndrome

name: Splenius Capitis

innervation.nerve: Posterior rami of cervical nerves

palpation: Deep to trapezius, lateral to cervical spine
notes: Works with contralateral SCM for rotation

name: Splenius Cervicis

innervation.nerve: Posterior rami of cervical nerves

palpation: Deep to trapezius, difficult to isolate

name: Semispinalis Capitis
insertion: Between superior and inferior nuchal lines of occipital bone

innervation.nerve: Posterior rami of cervical nerves
Posterior rami of cervical nerves

name: Rectus Capitis Posterior Major
insertion: Lateral inferior nuchal line of occipital bone

innervation.nerve: Suboccipital nerve

clinical_relevance: High density of muscle spindles for proprioception
palpation: Deep to semispinalis, requires specific technique

name: Rectus Capitis Posterior Minor
insertion: Medial inferior nuchal line of occipital bone

innervation.nerve: Suboccipital nerve

clinical_relevance: May have connection to dura mater

name: Obliquus Capitis Superior

innervation.nerve: Suboccipital nerve

clinical_relevance: Forms superior border of suboccipital triangle
stretching_positions: Lateral flexion away with slight flexion

name: Obliquus Capitis Inferior

innervation.nerve: Suboccipital nerve

notes: No attachment to skull despite name

name: Longus Colli

innervation.nerve: Direct branches from cervical plexus

clinical_relevance: Important deep stabilizer, weak in forward head posture
notes: Three parts: superior oblique, inferior oblique, vertical

name: Longus Capitis

innervation.nerve: Direct branches from cervical plexus

clinical_relevance: Deep cervical flexor, important for stability
notes: Works with longus colli for cervical stability

innervation.nerve: Anterior rami
Anterior rami

unilateral: Lateral flexion of head at atlanto-occipital joint

name: Platysma
origin: Fascia over pectoralis major and deltoid

innervation.nerve: Cervical branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

bilateral: Assists in forced depression of mandible

functional_movements: Facial expression of horror or surprise
clinical_relevance: Muscle of facial expression, platysmal bands with aging
common_trigger_points: Not typically treated for trigger points
notes: Superficial muscle, involved in facial expression

name: Digastric - Anterior Belly

innervation.nerve: Mylohyoid nerve (from mandibular division of CN V)

notes: Two bellies connected by intermediate tendon

name: Digastric - Posterior Belly

innervation.nerve: Digastric branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

clinical_relevance: Can compress internal jugular vein if hypertonic
notes: Different nerve supply than anterior belly

name: Stylohyoid

innervation.nerve: Stylohyoid branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

clinical_relevance: Perforated by intermediate tendon of digastric

name: Mylohyoid

innervation.nerve: Mylohyoid nerve (from mandibular division of CN V)

notes: Important for oral phase of swallowing

innervation.nerve: C1 via hypoglossal nerve (CN XII)

bilateral: Depresses mandible when hyoid is fixed

innervation.nerve: Ansa cervicalis
Ansa cervicalis
C1 via hypoglossal nerve (CN XII)
Ansa cervicalis

name: Omohyoid - Inferior Belly

innervation.nerve: Ansa cervicalis

stretching_positions: Neck lateral flexion with shoulder depression
notes: Held in place by fascial sling

name: Masseter
insertion: Lateral surface of ramus and angle of mandible

innervation.nerve: Masseteric nerve (from mandibular division of CN V)

name: Temporalis

innervation.nerve: Deep temporal nerves (from mandibular division of CN V)

clinical_relevance: Large fan-shaped muscle, involved in TMJ disorders
palpation: Above zygomatic arch in temple region
notes: Anterior fibers elevate, posterior fibers retract

name: Medial Pterygoid
origin: Medial surface of lateral pterygoid plate
insertion: Medial surface of ramus and angle of mandible

innervation.nerve: Medial pterygoid nerve (from mandibular division of CN V)

name: Lateral Pterygoid - Superior Head
origin: Infratemporal surface of greater wing of sphenoid
insertion: Articular disc and capsule of TMJ

innervation.nerve: Lateral pterygoid nerve (from mandibular division of CN V)

name: Lateral Pterygoid - Inferior Head
origin: Lateral surface of lateral pterygoid plate
insertion: Pterygoid fovea on neck of mandible

innervation.nerve: Lateral pterygoid nerve (from mandibular division of CN V)

clinical_relevance: Only muscle of mastication that opens jaw

innervation.nerve: Temporal branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

name: Occipitalis
origin: Lateral two-thirds of superior nuchal line

innervation.nerve: Posterior auricular branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

notes: Connected to frontalis via galea aponeurotica

name: Orbicularis Oculi

innervation.nerve: Temporal and zygomatic branches of facial nerve (CN VII)

notes: Has orbital, palpebral, and lacrimal parts

name: Corrugator Supercilii

innervation.nerve: Temporal branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

notes: Small but significant for facial expression

innervation.nerve: Buccal branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

bilateral: Creates horizontal lines on bridge of nose

innervation.nerve: Buccal branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

name: Orbicularis Oris
insertion: Skin and mucous membrane of lips

innervation.nerve: Buccal and mandibular branches of facial nerve (CN VII)

antagonists: Levator and depressor muscles of lips

name: Buccinator
origin: Alveolar processes of maxilla and mandible
insertion: Orbicularis oris at angle of mouth

innervation.nerve: Buccal branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

name: Zygomaticus Major
origin: Zygomatic bone anterior to zygomaticotemporal suture

innervation.nerve: Zygomatic and buccal branches of facial nerve (CN VII)

palpation: From zygomatic bone to mouth corner

name: Zygomaticus Minor
origin: Zygomatic bone posterior to zygomaticomaxillary suture
insertion: Upper lip lateral to levator labii superioris

innervation.nerve: Zygomatic and buccal branches of facial nerve (CN VII)
Zygomatic and buccal branches of facial nerve (CN VII)

name: Levator Labii Superioris Alaeque Nasi
latin_name: Musculus levator labii superioris alaeque nasi

innervation.nerve: Zygomatic and buccal branches of facial nerve (CN VII)
Zygomatic and buccal branches of facial nerve (CN VII)
Mandibular and buccal branches of facial nerve (CN VII)
Mandibular branch of facial nerve (CN VII)
Mandibular branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

name: Risorius

innervation.nerve: Buccal branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

notes: Highly variable or absent in 20% of people

innervation.nerve: Temporal branch of facial nerve (CN VII)
Temporal branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

name: Posterior Auricular

innervation.nerve: Posterior auricular branch of facial nerve (CN VII)

clinical_relevance: May be involved in some headaches
